title: How to Make a Cup of Tea Using the Microwave

steps.title: Put your tea bag or tea leaves inside the microwavable mug or cup.
steps.content: Put your tea bag or tea leaves inside the microwavable mug or cup. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Add enough water to cover the tea bag or tea leaves, about one to two tablespoons.
steps.content: Add enough water to cover the tea bag or tea leaves, about one to two tablespoons.

steps.title: Open the microwave and slip your cup inside.
steps.content: Open the microwave and slip your cup inside. Microwave on HIGH for about thirty seconds. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Cover the mug with a napkin, book, or bowl so the tea can steep.
steps.content: Cover the mug with a napkin, book, or bowl so the tea can steep . Leave it for about two minutes.

steps.title: Now remove the napkin, book, or bowl.
steps.content: Now remove the napkin, book, or bowl. And the teabag-be careful, it will still be hot! Resist the temptation to squeeze the bag-you will make the tea bitter. If you want to add sugar, honey, or lemon , now is the time to add it. Then fill the cup up to the brim with water.

steps.title: If you prefer your tea scalding hot, microwave the mug on high for another minute.
steps.content: If you prefer your tea scalding hot, microwave the mug on high for another minute. [3] X Research source
